isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 5000, 9100, 9200, 9400, AND 9900 MODELS - DETROIT DIESEL SERIES 60 ENGINES - OPERATION - COOLANT LEVEL PROBE

svcproc.title: COOLANT LEVEL PROBE
svcproc.para: The low coolant level probe is connected through the Navistar engine harness connector (278) circuit 34 to ECM (273). A signal from the ECM is sent to the probe on this circuit. The other side of the probe is connected to ground through circuits 34-G, 97-G, connector (N/L), circuits 97-G and 11-G, connector (N/L), and circuit 11-G to battery ground. When coolant level is below the probe, the circuit resistance changes, indicating to the ECM that the coolant level is below the critical level.
